unnormalised: ## Going Viral, Indian Style: What's Trending and Why!
normalised: ## Going Viral, Indian Style: What's Trending and Why!

unnormalised: Hey folks! Let's talk virality, desi style. We all dream of that one post that explodes, right? The one that gets shared faster than gossip at a kitty party in Defence Colony. But virality isn’t just luck; it’s a mix of timing, content, and understanding what makes India tick.
normalised: Hey folks! Let's talk virality, desi style. We all dream of that one post that explodes, right? The one that gets shared faster than gossip at a kitty party in Defence Colony. But virality isn’t just luck; it’s a mix of timing, content, and understanding what makes India tick.

unnormalised: So, what's trending right now? Honestly, it's a mixed bag. We saw the “pawri ho rahi hai” meme take off like a rocket back in early 2021. Now, it’s all about… well, depends! One day it might be a hilarious reel about the struggles of finding a decent auto rickshaw in Mumbai during rush hour at 17:00 hrs, the next it’s a heartwarming video of a grandma acing a classical dance performance.

unnormalised: The key is relatability. Indians love content that reflects our culture, our struggles, and our triumphs. Think about those videos showing students cracking the JEE exam – pure gold! Even something seemingly simple, like a trending hashtag celebrating Diwali on 24/10/2022, can go huge if it resonates with the collective spirit.

unnormalised: Influencer marketing plays a massive role too. Imagine Bhuvan Bam endorsing your product – instant visibility! But authenticity is crucial. People can smell a forced promotion a mile away, especially when they're scrolling through their feeds at 02:00 AM (we've all been there!).

unnormalised: What else works? Music and dance trends! Remember that song from Pushpa? “Srivalli”? It had everyone from Delhi aunties to college kids in Bangalore doing the hook step. Creating or participating in such trends is a guaranteed way to boost engagement.

unnormalised: And don't forget the power of nostalgia. Throwbacks to iconic Bollywood moments or even vintage advertisements from the 90s (remember the Cadbury ad with the girl dancing on the cricket field?) can trigger a massive wave of shares.

unnormalised: Ultimately, going viral is about understanding your audience, tapping into their emotions, and serving up content that’s both entertaining and relatable. So, keep experimenting, keep creating, and who knows? Maybe your content will be the next big thing to sweep the nation, maybe even by Independence Day 15/08/2024! Good luck!
